answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
Palm Beach County, FL, Government established a detailed "Social Networking Policy" for employees on Aug. 2, 2010. It includes seven unacceptable activities such as outside business use, online gambling, political postings,  accessing graphic materials, and public records law violations. The county policy (PPM# CW-R-013) can be viewed online at: www.pbcgov.com/publicaffairs/ppm/pdf/CW-R-013.pdf .

author: Xavier Bishop
text:
No doubt this question has come up before, but I’m interested in knowing how some of you have handled employee postings on social media websites, specifically as it relates to their displeasure w/ city policies. Have you taken direct action against an employee; have you implemented policies? What legal/administrative direction can you give? 
Thanks in advance.
